The $$$i$$$-th family has $$$a_i$$$ family members. All families will travel using a single bus consisting of $$$r$$$ rows with $$$2$$$ seats each.A person is consideredhappyif:Another family member is seated in the same row as them, orThey are sitting alone in their row (with an empty seat next to them).Determine the maximum number of happy people in an optimal seating arrangement. Note thateveryonemust be seated in the bus.It is guaranteed that all family members will fit on the bus. Formally, it is guaranteed that $$$\\displaystyle\\sum_{i=1}^{n}a_i \\le 2r$$$.InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 1000$$$). The description of the test cases follows.The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$r$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 100$$$; $$$1 \\le r \\le 500$$$) — the number of families and the number of rows in the bus.The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 10$$$) — the number of family members in each family.OutputFor each test case, output the maximum number of happy people in an optimal seating arrangement.ExampleInput43 32 3 13 32 2 24 51 1 2 24 53 1 1 3Output4 6 6 6NoteIn the first test case, the two members of the first family can sit together in the first row, while the two members of the second family can sit together in the second row. There are $n$ families traveling on a bus with $r$ rows, each row having 2 seats. Each family has $a_i$ members.  

A person is considered happy if:

* They are sitting with another family member in the same row.
* They are sitting alone in their row with an empty seat next to them.

Find the maximum number of happy people possible when seating all the families on the bus. 

**Input:**

* The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains two integers, $n$ (number of families) and $r$ (number of rows).
    * The second line contains $n$ integers, $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ (number of members in each family).

**Output:**

For each test case, output the maximum number of happy people possible.

You have a bus with a certain number of rows and seats.  Families of different sizes need to be seated on the bus.  A person is happy if they are sitting with another family member or if they are alone in a row with an empty seat next to them. Find the maximum number of happy people possible.
